intro: Synaedrys cyrtorhyncha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and establish in suitable habitats. Synaedrys cyrtorhyncha plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
